meanings.definition: A person or machine that bores square holes in wood.
meanings.sent1: The morticer at the workshop effortlessly drilled precise square holes in the wooden planks.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a morticer to make perfect square holes for the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The morticer and the drill had a competition to see who could make the neater square hole.
meanings.sent4: The morticer was like a skilled surgeon, carefully carving out square holes in the wood.
meanings.sent5: The loud whirring sound of the morticer echoed through the workshop as it worked its magic on the wood.
